drivers.name: bjc600
drivers.comments:
This driver is available in the Ghostscript Printer Application

Ghostscript's built-in standard driver for Canon's inkjet printers.

NOTE: Due to a bug GPL Ghostscript 8.63 crashes when using this driver with PDF input data. With PostScript the driver works just fine.

The bug is fixed in Ghostscript 8.64 and later. For Ghostscript 8.63 (and older) there is a patch available.

The PPDs from this site need Ghostscript 8.64 or newer or the patch to work correctly with PDF input.

drivers.name: bjc610XY.upp
drivers.comments: UPP files of this driver: bjc610a0.upp, bjc610a1.upp, bjc610a2.upp, bjc610a3.upp, bjc610a4.upp, bjc610a5.upp, bjc610a6.upp, bjc610a7.upp, bjc610a8.upp, bjc610b1.upp, bjc610b2.upp, bjc610b3.upp, bjc610b4.upp, bjc610b6.upp, bjc610b7.upp, bjc610b8.upp

notes:
Actually, I used the bjc610 uniprint driver setting from RedHat's printtool.
This multifunction machine ignored me until I gave it this magic invocation from the front panel: "Function" "0" five-greater-than-signs "Start" "Start" (Which corresponds to DOS Printing ON)

Consumables/Refills: cartridge
